snippet: The district attorney’s office, citing advanced fire science, plans to ask a judge to throw out the convictions of three men who were found guilty of six felony murders and second-degree arson.
abstract: Prosecutors plan to ask Brooklyn Supreme Court judge to throw out arson convictions of William Vasquez, Amaury Villalobos and Raymond Mora, who were found guilty in 1980 of setting fire at Park Slope apartment that killed mother and five children; modern analysis finds no evidence that fire was result of arson; convictions, if overturned, will be 15th, 16th and 17th vacated by Brooklyn District Atty Ken Thompson.
lead_paragraph: The district attorney’s office, citing advanced fire science, plans to ask a judge to throw out the convictions of three men who were found guilty of six felony murders and second-degree arson.

headline.main: Brooklyn Prosecutors Revisit 3 Convictions in Fatal 1980 Fire
